title-group.article-title: Politics of Care: Commentary on Janelle S. Taylor, "On Recognition, Caring, and Dementia"

ref.mixed-citation: Giddens goes on to suggest, the conventions of lifelong marital commitment give way to the pure relationship: "A pure relationship is one in which external criteria have become dissolved: the relationship exists solely for whatever rewards that relationship can deliver" (1992:6).
